title: Conducting Community Needs & Assets Assessments in Timor-Leste Quiz

questions.question: What is the purpose of conducting community needs and assets assessments?
choices: To identify community strengths and areas for improvement
To find faults in community members
To impose external solutions on the community
To assess the profitability of local businesses
questions.answer: To identify community strengths and areas for improvement

questions.question: Community needs and assets assessments contribute to building resilient communities.
What is the main difference between needs-based and asset-based approaches?
choices: Needs-based focuses on deficits, while asset-based focuses on strengths
Needs-based is more effective than asset-based
There is no difference between the two approaches
questions.answer: Needs-based focuses on deficits, while asset-based focuses on strengths

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of a physical community asset in Timor-Leste?
Local businesses and markets are examples of economic community assets.
Traditional leadership structures are considered social community assets.
Arts and languages are examples of cultural community assets.
Community participation is not important in conducting assessments.
Which of the following is NOT a common method for community assessments?
Community mapping exercises can help identify local assets and needs.
Key informant interviews involve gathering information from:
choices: Community members with specific knowledge or expertise
External experts unfamiliar with the community
questions.answer: Community members with specific knowledge or expertise

questions.question: PRA stands for:
Setting clear objectives is an important step in planning a community assessment.
Ensuring inclusivity in the assessment process is not a priority.
Language and literacy considerations should be addressed when conducting assessments in Timor-Leste.
Informed consent is an important ethical consideration in community assessments.
Which of the following is NOT a challenge for conducting assessments in Timor-Leste?
Balancing traditional and modern assessment methods is important in Timor-Leste.
The case study analysis in this lesson focuses on:
choices: A community assessment conducted in Timor-Leste
An assets mapping exercise in Brazil
A market research study in China
questions.answer: A community assessment conducted in Timor-Leste

questions.question: In the hands-on activity, students design a mini needs and assets assessment plan for:
Identifying key areas to assess is a step in designing a community assessment plan.
Ensuring community participation and inclusivity is not a consideration in the assessment planning process.
Analyzing and prioritizing assessment findings is important for turning assessment into action.
Assessment results should be kept confidential and not shared with the community.
Community assessment results can inform the development of community action plans.
The student assignment involves conducting a mini assets mapping exercise in their own community or neighborhood.
In the assignment report, students should reflect on challenges faced during the assets mapping exercise.
The assignment asks students to provide ideas for leveraging identified assets for community development.
Providing suggestions for a more comprehensive community assessment is not part of the student assignment.
The main objective of this lesson is to:
choices: Introduce students to community needs and assets assessments in the Timor-Leste context
Teach students how to conduct assessments in developed countries
Discourage the use of participatory methods in community development
Promote top-down approaches to community assessment
questions.answer: Introduce students to community needs and assets assessments in the Timor-Leste context
